page.title: 13LITTLE WITLEY AGRICULTURE-2
page.content: The{grassland}is nearly all permanent pastures grazed by stock with a hay and sileage crop (bagged and clamped) taken off most fields. There is just one dairy holding of Friesians, which are crossed with Limousin or Charolais bulls to produce good{beef}cattle, which are reared within yards on the holding. The rest of the{stock}consists of one flock of Clun ewes crossed by a Suffolk and a large number of store cattle and sheep bought in and kept in "halves" to be fattened off using home grown arable products. A high proportion of{woodland}is contained within the area. This is either managed by the Forestry Commission or by the Harris brush company, for whom the sycamore and chestnut are ideal for paintbrush handles.
